meanings.definition: Relating to or consisting of feces.
meanings.sent1: The vet examined the dog's fecal sample for any signs of illness.
meanings.sent2: The bathroom had a strong fecal odor after someone forgot to flush.
meanings.sent3: The children found it hilarious to make up silly songs about fecal matter.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were littered with fecal waste, a sad reflection of neglect.
meanings.sent5: The image of the overflowing trash can was a fecal reminder of the need for cleanliness.

meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the fecal matter under a microscope to identify any parasites.
meanings.sent2: The muddy footprints on the carpet had a fecal appearance, causing concern.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the chef's attempt to create a fecal-shaped dessert.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds in the sky had a fecal hue, signaling an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the fecal texture of the mud in exquisite detail.
